Detailed Description

Class that represent a hashtable for elements with a location.

The class is intended to speed up the time to find an element at a specific location. Things to do in the subclasses:

  • Support a method that adds an element to the hashcells.
  • Support a method that builds the hashtable from scratch including allocating memory for m_hashCell since the LocationHashCell is abstract.
  • It's convenient to have a method that returns a pointer to an element when calling method getClosest() instead of the hashcell and an offset.

Member Function Documentation

void LocationHashTable::addToNeighbours (  uint64  elmDist,
int32  vpos,
int32  hpos,
int32  v,
int32  h,
int32  dv,
int32  dh,
uint32  vIndex[],
uint32  hIndex[],
uint64  sqDist[],
int32 &  nbr
)  [protected]
 

This method does some of the dirty work in getClosest().

It's used to get neighbour-cells that's close to (vpos, hpos). If a neighbourcell is closer than the closest element in cell[v][h] the neibours cell-index and squaredistance will be stored.

Parameters:
elmDist Distance to closest element in cell[v][h].
vpos The vertical position to find elements at.
hpos The horizontal position to find elements at.
v The vertical cell-index where vpos lies.
h The horizontal cell-index where hpos lies.
dv Vertical offset to neighbour.
dh Horizontal offset to neighbour.
vIndex Vertical cell-index of close neighbours.
hIndex Horizontal cell-index of close neighbours.
sqDist Squaredistance to neighbours.
nbr The number of neighbours with a distance to (vpos, hpos)less than elmDist.

void LocationHashTable::getAllWithinMC2BoundingBox (  set< uint32 > &  ids,
const MC2BoundingBox &  bbox
) 
 

Finds all elements inside the bounding box and puts them into the set.

Parameters:
ids Set to add the item ids to.
bbox Bounding box to look inside.

Vector* LocationHashTable::getAllWithinMC2BoundingBox (  const MC2BoundingBox *  bbox,
bool &  shouldKill
) 
 

Finds all elements inside the boundingbox.

Parameters:
bbox The boundingbox.
shouldKill Is set to true if the Vector* returned by this method should be deleted by the caller. Set to false if the caller must not delete the Vector.
Returns:
Pointer to a Vector containing IDs of the items within the bounding box.
Remarks:
The returned vector must be deleted if shouldKill-parameter is true, and must not be deleted if that parameter is false.

void LocationHashTable::getAllWithinRadius (  set< uint32 > &  ids,
int32  hpos,
int32  vpos,
int32  radius
) 
 

Finds all elements inside the circle defined by (hpos, vpos) and radius.

This version does not copy as much as the one above.

Parameters:
ids The id:s of the found items are put here.
hpos The horizontal part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
vpos The vertical part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
radius The maximum distance from (hpos, vpos) to the items returned by this method. The uint on the radius depends on the unit returned by the virtual distance methods, implemented in the subclasses.

Vector* LocationHashTable::getAllWithinRadius (  int32  hpos,
int32  vpos,
int32  radius,
bool &  shouldKill
) 
 

Finds all elements inside the circle defined by (hpos, vpos) and radius.

Parameters:
hpos The horizontal part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
vpos The vertical part of the coordinate for the center of the circle.
radius The maximum distance from (hpos, vpos) to the items returned by this method. The uint on the radius depends on the unit returned by the virtual distance methods, implemented in the subclasses.
shouldKill Is set to true if the Vector* returned by this methos should be deleted by the caller. Set to false if the caller must not delete the Vector.
Returns:
Pointer to a Vector containing IDs of the items within a distance < radius from (hpos, vpos). NB! This must be deleted if shouldKill-parameter is true, and must not be deleted if that parameter is false.

LocationHashCell* LocationHashTable::getClosest (  int32  hpos,
int32  vpos,
uint32 &  offset,
uint64 &  dist,
bool  areaItem = false
) 
 

Finds an element closest to (hpos, vpos).

Parameters:
hpos Horizontal position to match.
vpos Vertical position to match.
offset Where in the datastructure the element can be found.
dist Distance to the closest item. The unit of this distance depends on the unit returned by the virtual distance methods.
Returns:
The cell where the element can be found. if no element is found NULL is returned, this is however extremely rare.

Vector* LocationHashTable::removeDups (  Vector *  proximityResult  )  [protected]
 

Merges the vectors from the proximitysearch to ensure that the result has no doubles.

The proximityResult cannot be used after this function has been called.

Parameters:
proximityResult The result to remove dups from.
Returns:
A Vector with the result from the merge. To be deleted by the user.
